subSections.title: Glyph origin
Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[bolt]]; [[latch]]; [[crossbar]]
# to [[bolt]]; to [[latch]]
# {{lb|zh|Cantonese|dialectal Hakka}} to [[close]]; to [[switch off]]; to [[turn off]]

subSections.title: References
subSections.text: [http://dict.variants.moe.edu.tw/variants/rbt/word_attribute.rbt?quote_code=QTA0Mzcx| Dictionary of Chinese Character Variants (教育部異體字字典)]

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja|閂 (錠)}} {{wp|lang=ja|閂 (相撲)}} [[file:Asso, chiavistello porta Magnocavallo.JPG|thumb|right|'''{{lang|ja|閂}}''' ('''''kannuki''''') a [[wood]]en [[crossbar]] used as a [[latch]]]]
{{ja-kanjitab|かんぬき|yomi=kun}} {{IPAchar|/kwan no ki/}} → {{IPAchar|/kwanːoki/}} → {{IPAchar|/kwanːuki/}} → {{IPAchar|/kanːuki/}} Shift from {{m|ja|貫の木|tr=kan no ki|lit=1-''{{ll|ja|貫|kan}}'' (3.75-[[kilogram]]/8.267-[[pound]]) [[wood]]}}{{R:Daijisen}} or {{m|ja|関の木|tr=kan no ki|lit=[[wood]]en [[barrier]]}}, possibly influenced by {{m|ja|貫|tr=nuki||[[wood]]en [[beam]] used in [[joinery]]}}. The kanji spelling is {{juku|sort=かんぬき}}, borrowed from {{bor|ja|zh|sort=かんぬき|閂}}.
